appearance: Scorching or black colorations at the end of the flow path or at points of confluence of melt streams (entrapped air).
cause:
1.Poor venting of mold at flow path ends or
2.Confluence of several melt fronts.
In both cases the air to be displaced from the mold cavity is highly compressed and so overheated that the plastic melt chars locally.
correction:
1.Provide effective venting in the critical regions; reduce injection speed, and melt temperature.
2.Identify critical points at the planning stage using a moldflow simulation, for example, and correct the shape, gate location and wall thickness-distribution of the part by modifications.
3.Decrease clamp force to provide a temporary solution.
